fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators

Class SimulationEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.SimulationEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventsExchangingI, ModelDescriptionI, ParentNotificationI, SimulationManagementI, SimulatorI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicEngine, CoordinationEngine

    public abstract class SimulationEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements SimulatorI, java.io.Serializable
    The class SimulationEngine defines the basic behaviour of a DEVS simulator declared by the interface SimulatorI.

    Description

    A DEVS simulation engine provides an implementation of a simulation algorithm that complies with the DEVS protocol. It is linked to a DEVS simulation model through the method setSimulatedModel. It then can perform simulation runs by calling doStandAloneSimulation when its model is self-contained or is a coupled model at the root of a DEVS models hierarchy and the simulation algorithm is based on the DEVS standard top-down coordination approach. Simulation runs can also be launched by calling startCollaborativeSimulation when the simulation model is a coupled one and the coordination algorithm rather use a peer-to-peer approach like the ones based on using the real time as the simulation time. Simulations end either by reaching their end simulation time or by calling stopSimulation.

    The implementation provided here follows the spirit of the description appearing in:

    H. Vangheluwe, Discrete Event System Specification (DEVS) formalism, courseware, 2001.

    Note: the implementation in non-reentrant, hence simulation runs must be executed in sequence.

    A baseline DEVS simulator observe a protocol built around the following operations:

    • internal event step: processing an internal event at a given simulated time;
    • external event step: processing a given external event at a given simulated time.

    See AtomicModelI for a description of internal and external steps. A stand alone simulation is run by iterating internal steps until the end of the simulation. A modular concurrent or distributed simulation requires the exchange of external events, the coordination of clock advances to always execute the next event that occurs and the execution of external event steps when required.

    Invariant

     invariant              true // TODO

    Created on : 2016-01-15

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int debugLevel
      Debugging level controlling the execution traces.
      protected boolean isRunning
      true if the simulation has been started and has not ended.
      protected Duration nextTimeAdvance
      Duration until the time of next event, i.e. the time of next event minus the time of the current state.
      protected ParentNotificationI parent
      Local coordination engine for this simulator, or null if it stands alone or the parent is remote.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      protected ModelI simulatedModel
      model to be executed by the simulator.
      static long SIMULATION_STEP_SLEEP_TIME
      sleep time slowing down the simulation steps for demos.
      protected Time simulationEndTime
      time at which the simulation must end.
      protected boolean stoppedSimulation
      true if the simulation has been stopped (from outside).
      protected Time timeOfLastEvent
      time at which the last event has been executed.
      protected Time timeOfNextEvent
      time at which the next event, internal, external or confluent, must be executed.
      protected Time timeOfStart
      time of the beginning of the simulation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimulationEngine()
      create a DEVS simulation engine either standalone or collaborative and, if collaborative, using a generated external inbound port URI.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean closed()
      return true if the model is closed.
      protected void computeNextEventToBeSimulated()
      compute the next event to be simulated and update the internal state accordingly.
      void doStandAloneSimulation(double startTime, double simulationDuration)
      do a stand alone simulation lasting simulatedTimeDuration and starting at startTime.
      void endSimulation(Time endTime)
      terminate the current simulation, doing the necessary catering tasks.
      void finaliseSimulation()
      finalise the simulation, disposing all resources and reinitialising the models and simulators so that a new simulation run can be undertaken.
      ModelDescriptionI getDescendentModel(java.lang.String uri)
      get a Java reference on the object representing a model that is a descendant or the model executing the method.
      java.lang.Class<? extends EventI>[] getExportedEventTypes()
      return an array of event types exported by the model.
      java.lang.Class<? extends EventI>[] getImportedEventTypes()
      return an array of event types imported by the model.
      Duration getNextTimeAdvance()
      return the duration until the next internal event as previously computed by timeAdvance().
      ParentNotificationI getParent()
      return the parent (coupled) model of null if the model is the root of the coupled model hierarchy or if the model is a coupled model but its submodels are simulated by different simulation engines.
      java.lang.String getParentURI()
      return the URI of the parent (coupled) model of null if the model is the root of the coupled model hierarchy.
      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit getSimulatedTimeUnit()
      return the time unit of the simulation clock.
      Time getSimulationEndTime()
      return the time at which the simulation ends.
      Time getTimeOfLastEvent()
      return the time of occurrence of the last event.
      Time getTimeOfNextEvent()
      return the currently forecast time of occurrence of the next event.
      Time getTimeOfStart()
      return the time at which the simulation started.
      java.lang.String getURI()
      return the unique identifier of this simulation model.
      boolean hasDebugLevel(int debugLevel)
      true if the current debug level is equal to debugLevel, false otherwise.
      protected void initialise()
      initialise the simulation engine.
      void initialiseSimulation(Duration simulationDuration)
      initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to 0; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.
      void initialiseSimulation(Time startTime, Duration simulationDuration)
      initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.
      boolean isDebugModeOn()
      return true if the debug level is greater than 0.
      boolean isExportedEventType(java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ec)
      return true if ec is an exported event type of this model.
      boolean isImportedEventType(java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ec)
      return true if ec is an imported event type of this model.
      boolean isModelSet()
      return true if the simulator has been given its model to be simulated.
      boolean isParentSet()
      return true if the parent reference is set.
      boolean isRoot()
      return true if this model is the root of a composition.
      boolean isSimulationInitialised()
      return true if the simulation has been initialised for a run.
      boolean isSimulationRunning()
      return true if a simulation run is currently executing.
      java.lang.String modelAsString(java.lang.String indent)
      return the model information as a string.
      void setDebugLevel(int newDebugLevel)
      set the debug level.
      void setParent(ParentReferenceI p)
      set the parent of this model to cm.
      void setSimulatedModel(ModelI simulatedModel)
      associate the provided simulation model with the simulation engine.
      void showCurrentState(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      print the current state.
      void showCurrentStateContent(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      print the content of the current state, without pre- and post-formatting.
      java.lang.String simulatorAsString()
      return the simulator information as a string.
      void startRealTimeSimulation(double startTime, double simulationDuration)
      start a collaborative simulation at startTime lasting simulationDuration.
      void stopSimulation()
      interrupt the current simulation and trigger the sending of the simulation report to the client if appropriately connected.
      void toggleDebugMode()
      activate the lowest debug level or deactivate the debug mode completely.

               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ModelDescriptionI
        return true if the model is closed.

        Description

        A model is closed if it has no imported event. A model can be considered as closed even if it exports events because they can be executed with their exported events not consumed by any other model.

      • getDescendentModel

        public ModelDescriptionI getDescendentModel(java.lang.String uri)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ModelDescriptionI
        get a Java reference on the object representing a model that is a descendant or the model executing the method.

        Description

        As this method returns a reference on a Java object, it must be used with much care. Models are not callable through RMI, hence it should not be called through RMI (i.e., among components). Also, direct access to the object representing a model should be read-only, as changing the state of the model can interfere severely with the simulation protocol.

        Contract

         pre     uri != null
 pre     isDescendentModel(uri)
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        getDescendentModel in interface ModelDescriptionI
        Parameters:
        uri - this model or a submodel URI.
        Returns:
        the model with the corresponding URI.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        ModelDescriptionI.getDescendentModel(java.lang.String)
